original_title: Trade Unions to hold discussion over tax policy and future activities
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Professionals' Trade Union Collective will hold a special meeting on Friday (31) to discuss the future activities of the trade unions.
The meeting comes against a backdrop of a pending discussion with President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sri Lanka's tax policy.

"Another letter was sent to the President and President's Secretary on Thursday (30), requesting for a discussion on the tax policy," Spokesperson of the Government Medical Officers' Association Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe said.
"We will resume their trade union actions if their requests are continuously disregarded," he added.
In the meantime, the Federation of University Teachers' Association warned that they will intensify their strike if solutions are not provided to their issues.
